alert.note: Alert for Hamilton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued February 17 at 3:49AM EST until February 17 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM EST THIS MORNING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. 1 to 2 inches of rainfall with locally higher amounts. * WHERE...Portions of Indiana, Northern Kentucky and Ohio, including the following counties, in Indiana, Dearborn, Fayette IN, Franklin IN, Ohio, Ripley, Switzerland, Union IN and Wayne. In Northern Kentucky, Boone, Campbell, Gallatin and Kenton. In Ohio, Auglaize, Brown, Butler, Champaign, Clark, Clermont, Clinton, Darke, Delaware, Fairfield, Fayette OH, Franklin OH, Greene, Hamilton, Hardin, Highland, Hocking, Licking, Logan, Madison, Mercer, Miami, Montgomery, Pickaway, Preble, Ross, Shelby, Union OH and Warren. * WHEN...From 7 AM EST this morning through late tonight. * IMPACTS...Saturated soils and excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: People in the watch area, especially those living in areas prone to flooding, should be prepared to take action should flooding develop. Monitor the latest forecasts and be alert for possible flood warnings.
